About UsAt SoCalGas, we believe that every Californian deserves a resilient energy future.  We are working to achieve that future by empowering California to reach its sustainability goals through innovation, collaboration, and decarbonization. As our state’s energy needs change, we will be there providing reliable energy that is clean, safe, and affordable to our 22 million customers.  In addition to helping shape the future of hydrogen technology and clean energy, as an employee of SoCalGas you’ll also enjoy an aggressive total compensation plan, multiple upward mobility opportunities and the ability to find a true work life balance.   We also strive to reflect the communities we serve by attracting top talent and maintaining a diverse workforce.  To discover more about how rewarding it is to work here, we invite you to visit these pages on our website: Our Mission; DE&I, Sustainability, In the Community, and Employee Benefits. Join SoCalGas today to share in our mission to build the cleanest, safest, and most innovative energy company in America!   Primary PurposeThe Director of System & Technology leads teams in the delivery and support of strategic customer systems, technology, and solutions. Collaborates with others across technology organizations and business functions to deliver innovative technology solutions that provides value to SoCalGas and its customers.Drives the development and delivery of digital capabilities that are aligned with the vision of delivering superior customer service and experience. Leads the effort to drive the development of digital strategies and technology roadmaps from assessment to architecture design through implementation and adoption, including the management of change (MOC).Communicates the digital vision and strategy for customer systems to Senior Management and the Board of Directors as necessary. Effectively manages the financial investments in our customer systems in a way that maximizes the value of those investments.ResponsibilitiesAdvance and Support Customer Systems CapabilitiesDrives the development of innovative solutions in a variety of areas including: external facing systems and contact center technology, Gas Scheduling and Measurement, Work Management systems, and Technology related services (e.g., governance, data integration, architectural standards, and project portfolio management). This includes the systems that will be replaced by the Vista program which includes SoCalGas’ current Workforce Management System (WMS) and Customer Information System (CIS) and related systems. Provides the primary in-house technology support for the Vista programDevelops and enhances overall technology and digital strategy for customer systems and technology solutions. Acts as a thought-leader, driving digital innovation and influencing strategic technology direction (e.g., Cloud migration and adoption, digital twins, advanced analytics and artificial intelligence, agile methodologies, etc.) Assesses digital footprint, developing short and long-term plans for improvements, and develops and delivers presentations that are supportive of obtaining understanding and buy-in for digital investments.Works with key vendors and strategic partners to build a ‘one team’ delivery model with a focus on agility, collaboration, and high performance.Shapes the strategic direction of groups and teams, working to drive value-based prioritization where an evaluation of intangibles is integrated with balancing the needs of multiple high-level stakeholders is required.Represents company at industry functions to continually stay current on new technologies.Organization Alignment & SupportFacilitates alignment of technology / digital initiatives and strategies with broader business priorities and opportunities through engagement and collaboration. Acts as a liaison and develops effective partnerships with internal and external stakeholders. Demonstrates effective problem-solving and continuous improvement as it relates to technology and business operations. Effectively manages financial performance and communicates project updates / status to senior management and company leadership in a timely manner.Acts as a liaison by collaborating, supporting, and engaging with other departments with responsibility for customer focused technology (e.g., Customer Programs and Asst.).Leadership & People ManagementWorks with broader leadership team to build alignment and trust. Models behaviors of authentic and forward-looking leadership, and commitment to high performance as "one team."Responsible for departmental leadership and direction setting with a focus on collaboration and conflict resolution.Primary leader for the department, providing direction, motivation, and strategic oversight.Responsible for all aspects of employee performance management, training, and development.Supervises managers and group-level leadership. Supports, coaches. and mentors team members.Develops, attracts and retains top talent so the organization is viewed as a model for high performance and agility.Leadership & Culture ShapingDemonstrates a work style that aligns with Sempra/SoCalGas values (Shape the future, Do the right thing, Champion people).Models and enhances the organization’s culture - trusted, accessible, inclusive, transparent, team-oriented, professional. Positively contributes to an environment of innovation, problem-solving, and continuous improvement. Instills and earns trust, empowering individuals while facilitating collaborative decision-making. Creates a supportive work climate that enables project team members to develop professionally. Values diversity, promotes teamwork, and emphasizes quality, customer satisfaction, and cost effectiveness.Fosters a growth mindset and is outcome focused.Performs other duties as assigned (no more than 5% of duties).Fiscal/Budget ResponsibilitiesProvides effective oversight and management of a technology organization with up to $50M in operating expenses and $100M in capital investments annually.$160500 - $240800 / year#scgjobsQualificationsEducationBachelor's Degree Information technology, management information systems, computer engineering, or IT related field. RequiredMaster's Degree MBA or Masters in the field listed above. PreferredExperience12 years practical, hands-on, and deep/diverse experiences along a broad technology spectrum including systems (i.e., Applications development, web / mobile applications, batch and real-time data integrations artificial intelligence, big data analytics, etc.). Required7 years broad IT experience: i.e., Applications Development, Project and Portfolio Management Office (PMO), Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), and Organizational Change Management (included in the overall 12 years listed above). Required5 years experience managing large, high-performing teams, integrators and managed services providers (included in the overall 12 years listed above). Required2 years Amazon Web Services (AWS) or Azure cloud solution implementation experience (both SAAS and PAAS), cloud migration experience. SAP implementation experience (e.g., ERP, Customer, S/4 HANA) are all highly desiredProfessional experience in the utility industry. PreferredKnowledge, Skills And AbilitiesLeadership: Outstanding organizational leadership skills with a track record of building strong teams, leading/influencing others, and gaining cooperation and support. Leverages broad thinking skills and considers long-term risk and implications when making decisions and setting strategies. Considers “customer and stakeholder impact” when developing vision, strategy, and implementing solutions. Advanced RequiredAbility to motivate employees, drive innovation and lead change initiatives while maintaining employee engagement. Advanced RequiredProduct Management: Product management skills, including the ability to communicate and inspire product vision, strategy and roadmap. Advanced RequiredStrategic and Visionary Thinking: Excellent strategic and conceptual thinking skills, and the ability to apply unique business insights and make sound decisions aligned to business goals in order to create competitive advantage for the organization. Advanced RequiredTechnology Trends: Demonstrates a strong understanding of emerging trends in the technology landscape, including new technologies, processes, and ways of working. Able to determine the impact of technological advancement on the company's systems, applications, infrastructure, and practices. Advanced RequiredAgile Methodologies: Knowledge of concepts, including Agile Scrum and/or Kanban, and application of Agile methodology (e.g., Lean, SAFe, LeSS) for project management to be able to design, implement and manage projects. Intermediate RequiredFinancial Acumen: Strong financial acumen, including the ability to accurately report spending in the IT function and an understanding of both CapEx and OpEx budgets. Advanced RequiredCross-functional Collaboration: Ability to participate in co-operative working relationships including knowledge sharing and partnership in achieving solutions within and across business or operational functions. Advanced RequiredDevSecOps Practices: Strong understanding of automation and security concepts and processes (e.g., test automation, code coverage, DevSecOps, Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) pipelines, etc.), and ability to drive the integration of development, operations, and security into enterprise software development. Advanced PreferredFamiliarity with regulatory and compliance processes, proceedings, and frameworks Intermediate PreferredLicenses and CertificationsScaled Agile Framework (SAFe) Leading SAFe Certification. PreferredOther QualificationsMust be willing to relocate, if necessary, and live in the Los Angeles area.Must travel regularly to both San Diego and Los Angeles locations.May require 24/7 response availability or work outside of normal business hours.Requires valid CA driver’s license or reliable transportation.BenefitsSoCalGas offers a comprehensive benefits program to help support employees both personally and professionally. These benefits include, but are not limited to:  Competitive pay & Annual Bonus program  Medical, dental, and vision packages (plus free Mental Health resources/sessions)  401K company match & Company provided Pension Plan  Work/Life Balance including generous PTO  Wellness Programs/Classes   Tuition / Education Reimbursement  Career Development Tools & Resources through SoCalGas University  Follow us on social media to stay current with what we’ve been up to on Twitter (SCG) , Facebook (SCG) , YouTube (SCG ) and Instagram (@SCG)Total Rewards PhilosophyNote: SoCalGas strives to ensure that employees are paid equitably and competitively. Starting salaries may vary based on factors such as relevant experience, qualifications, and education.SoCalGas offers a competitive total rewards package that goes beyond base salary. This position iseligible for an annual performance-based incentive (bonus) as well as long-term incentive plans and other merit-based recognition. Company benefits include health and welfare (medical, dental, vision), employer contributions to retirement benefits, life insurance, paid time off, as well as other company offerings such as tuition reimbursement, paid parental leave, and employee assistance programs.
